result.execSummary:
The defendant Ametrius D Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ametrius D Robinson

defendant.name: Robinson, Ametrius D
defendant.address: 205 Laurel Dr Apt B, North Aurora, IL 60542

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(2:54 PM cases 20CF1548, 22CF351 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ametrius D Robinson in court. Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Ametrius D Robinson. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF351 and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF351 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF351 Count 1.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:
Not to possess any firearms. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 20CF1548, 20TR7935, 20TR7936, 20TR7937, 20TR7938, 20TR7939 are dismissed and read in. Trial in 20CF1548 is removed from the calendar.

(1:00 PM cases 20CF1548, 22CF351 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ametrius D Robinson does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Ametrius D Robinson. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with.
State notes the defendant called the Branch 4 Judicial Assistant and advised is on the way and running about 10 minutes late.
Attorney Steuer advises there are other matters to address prior to the miranda good child hearing.
Court advises will not hearing anything without the defendant present. Court advises will be in chambers if/when the defendant appears.
(Off record at 1:03 pm.)
(1:22 PM cases 20CF1548, 22CF351 recalled.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ametrius D Robinson in court. Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Ametrius D Robinson.
Victim/Witness statute complied with.
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties for 22CF351 and is proved with a copy of the complaint by Attorney Steuer.
Court schedules preliminary hearing for 22CF351 for April 5, 2022 at 2 pm.  
Regarding case 20CF1548, Attorney Steuer advises yesterday (03/29/2022) the defendant informed Attorney Steuer that he has requested the State Public Defender's Office appoint new counsel, which has been verified with the SPD Office. Attorney Steuer requests adjournment for the trial scheduled for tomorrow.
Court orders Attorney Steuer will be stand by counsel if the SPD is unable to have counsel present and is not adjourning the trial.
Attorney Steuer advises the relationship between him and the defendant is broken.
Court orders the case will proceed to trial as scheduled.
Miranda Motion to be heard at 8:30 am tomorrow morning (03/30/2022).
State notes Attorney Steuer cannot be stand by counsel as a staff attorney for the SPD Office. Attorney Steuer advises he is a staff attorney for the SPD Office. 
Attorney Steuer advises a witness has advised will not attend tomorrow and a governor's subpoena will need to be done. State has subpoenaed the witness.
Court orders case will proceed as scheduled.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
